column4: Hi.  Is there a command line program to install ubuntu packages that does all the fun stuff like automatically installing dependancies and asking configuration questions?
is it sort of the command line synaptic?
PingFloyd, yes, I want something like either apt-get or aptitude that will work on a downloaded .deb file
and it can not be gdebi (has a gui)?
I was looking for something that comes with ubuntu-server
I want it to install the dependencies, not ignore them
it's just a software application/solution that my team is developing

it works great in ubuntu-desktop because I can just tell the customer to double click on the .deb file, and it does everything automatically and asks the users questions, etc.  But now my customers are complaining that there isn't an easy way to install it in ubuntu-server
I am almost positive that there is a option for dpkg or something like that to install deps
that's what I was thinking, but I can't find it
and you read the man page?
the only thing I see for dependency checking is UNINSTALLING a package, not INSTALLING :(
ya, heh, totally, gdebi is a command line tool
but you should be able to test it out with gdebi on the command line
jrib, well I was hoping there was a tool that already came with Ubuntu, but if I have to require them to install gdebi ahead of time, I guess I'll do that
